unit_learning_outcomes.description: skilfully interact and/or work with others to accomplish complex tasks, identify the dynamics present within diverse groups and use intercultural knowledge to strategically engage with other actors to enhance communities.
express nuanced understandings of how language and culture interact, and evidence ability to apply language to solving real-word tasks.
increase their ability to clearly express, detail, defend, and/or promote ideas in public situations, through their native language and/or target language

show awareness of differences and similarities between language use in their native language or culture and the target language or culture, as well as thoughtful understandings of how to negotiate difficulties that arise during cross-cultural and/or cross-linguistic interactions

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students will produce reflections about their experience within their groups based on thoughtful reflection and logs of their activities while abroad, and engage with the online iLearn community.
non_scheduled_learning_activities.offerings: Session 2-Weekday-On location at placement, Session 1-Weekday-On location at placement, Session 3-Weekday-On location at placement, Winter vacation-Weekday-On location at placement

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students will produce reflections about their experience based on thoughtful reflection and logs of their activities during the project, and engage with the online iLearn community.

assessments.description: Students are required to satisfactorily complete the components of their approved program of study. The backup supplementary task for this assessment task must be an equivalent program or experience, arranged by the student with the host institution.

Students will produce a video wherein they discuss and reflect upon their experiences during the placement. The video should touch on an issue relating to what the student has learned, how they overcame challenges, how the experience related to their overall program of study, and the ways in which they will employ what they learned in the future study and/or community engagement. Additionally, students should discuss their preparation for the experience, and how this impacted their time at the host institution. The backup supplementary task for this assessment task is a travel diary discussing the experience.
assessments.offerings: Session 2-Weekday-On location at placement, Session 1-Weekday-On location at placement, Session 3-Weekday-On location at placement, Winter vacation-Weekday-On location at placement

The video should touch on an issue relating to what the student has learned, how they overcame challenges, how the experience related to their overall program of study, and the ways in which they will employ what they learned in the future study and/or community engagement. Additionally, students should discuss their preparation for the experience, and how this impacted their time during the project. The backup supplementary task for this assessment task is a project diary discussing the experience.

data.subject_search_title: INTS3016 - International Studies Advanced In-Country Study 1

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit is offered on a pass/fail basis. It is designed for students interested in the cultures and languages offered in the Department of International Studies who wish to study at a partner university. A program of study at the overseas university must be worked out in advance in consultation with the Department of International Studies, and approved by the Head of the Department of International Studies. Students will need to complete additional assessment at Macquarie University on their return from overseas. Students planning to take this option should discuss their plans as early as possible with the unit's staff contact.
